title: Error downloading solidity compiler on macOS
body:
- [ ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

Truffle failing to compile contracts

## Steps to Reproduce
```bash
npm i -g truffle
truffle init
truffle migrate
```

## Expected Behavior
Expected the command to be successful

## Actual Results
```bash
Compiling your contracts...
===========================
Error: Failed to fetch the Solidity compiler from the following locations: https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-wasm32/,https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-asmjs/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-asmjs/,https://solc-bin.ethereum.org/bin/,https://ethereum.github.io/solc-bin/bin/. Are you connected to the internet?


    at VersionRange.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:183:1)
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:8:1
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at exports.modules.780.__awaiter (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:4:1)
    at VersionRange.getSolcFromCacheOrUrl (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:174:1)
    at VersionRange.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:206:1)
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at fulfilled (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/compile-solidity/dist/compilerSupplier/loadingStrategies/VersionRange.js:5:43)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
Truffle v5.6.6 (core: 5.6.6)
Node v18.12.1
```

## Environment
**Operating System**: macOS 13.0.1 Ventura
**Truffle version**: `v5.6.6 `
**node version**: `v18.12.1`
**npm version**: `9.1.2`

Hello @XavierTM, 

>Error: Failed to fetch the Solidity compiler from the following locations: https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-wasm32/,https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-asmjs/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-asmjs/,https://solc-bin.ethereum.org/bin/,https://ethereum.github.io/solc-bin/bin/. 
Are you connected to the internet?

The error indicates you might have a network issue.  Can you run the following command and share the output? `DEBUG=*,-compile*,-dashboard*,-db*,-profile* truffle migrate`

> Hello @XavierTM,
> 
> > Error: Failed to fetch the Solidity compiler from the following locations: https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-wasm32/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-wasm32/,https://relay.trufflesuite.com/solc/emscripten-asmjs/,https://binaries.soliditylang.org/emscripten-asmjs/,https://solc-bin.ethereum.org/bin/,https://ethereum.github.io/solc-bin/bin/.
> > Are you connected to the internet?
> 
> The error indicates you might have a network issue. Can you run the following command and share the output? `DEBUG=*,-compile*,-dashboard*,-db*,-profile* truffle migrate`

@XavierTM Thanks for the data point! I was able to reproduce this by deleting my compiler cache.
@cds-amal any idea how to fix it?

@XavierTM, It started working for me. Strange! It's possible there was an intermittent issue on the Solidity side (endpoint that hosts the compilers). Can you try the command again?

I'll keep an eye for connectivity issues, and leave updates here. Sorry for the inconvenience!
@cds-amal It's still not working, could it be an issue of my region?
@cds-amal I figured out this could be a macOS issue, I tried on Kali Linux VM and it's working

Ok glad you got it working! We were unable to reproduce this issue on our side and so we'll go ahead and close this. If you experience this problem again feel free to comment and we'll re-open it. Thanks!
